content: the hope beanie is knitted in the round with a folded ribbed brim and stockinette body there is 3 rounds of decreases before finishing off the beanie it is knitted from the bottom up length of the ribbing or body can be adjusted by a few cm depending on personal preference and desired look of the beanie stitches used are knit purl and knit two together the pattern is suitable for experienced beginners recommended yarn 100 g andes by drops design 100g 90m recommended needles 9 mm double-pointed or circular using magic loop gauge 12 sts x 17 row = 10x10cm in stockinette on 9 mm needles i came up with the pattern when i decided to knit hats for charity i am providing this pattern entirely for free in the hopes that it inspires others to knit a hat for themselves and/or a hat for charity - for example for a local homeless shelter
